decision_conditions: <p>The existing use of the site is a School, which falls within Class F1 of the Use Classes Order. The proposal is therefore contrary to&nbsp;Schedule 2, Part 3, Class MA of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).</p>

<p>The proposed development, in the absence of a legal agreement to secure car-free housing,&nbsp; and lack of adequate information to determine if sufficient cycle parking can be provided, fails to promote sustainable modes of transport and would contribute to air pollution and congestion in the surrounding area,&nbsp; contrary to part MA,.2(2)(a) of Class MA, Part 3, Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).<br></p>

<p>The proposed development fails to demonstrate the proposed residential accommodation receives adequate natural light, contrary to MA,.2(2)(f) of Class MA, Part 3, Schedule 2 of The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).&nbsp;</p>

<p>The proposed development fails to demonstrate the residential accommodation would not result in adverse noise and disturbance impacts for intended occupiers from the ground floor restaurant and adjacent commercial uses and is contrary to MA,.2(2)(d) of Class MA, Part 3, Schedule 2 of The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).&nbsp;</p>

<p>The proposed change of use is contrary to MA.1(1) as the applicant has failed to demonstrate the property has been vacant for the previous 3 months; and is contrary to Class MA of Part 3 of Schedule 2 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).<br></p>
description: Prior Approval (Class MA) for a change of use of the first and second floors from school (Class F1) to a four bedroom flat (Class C3).
